title: School Segregation Index Builds
text:
Interaction Index is a measure of…
\[Interaction = \sum_{i=1}^n \left( \frac{B_i}{B} \right) \left( \frac{W_i}{T_i} \right)\]
Where:

\(B_i\) is the number of students of a particular racial group in a school \(i\).
\(B\) is the total number of students of the same racial group in the entire district.
\(W_i\) is the number of White students in school \(i\).
\(T_i\) is the total student enrollment of the school district \(i\).
\(n\) is the number of schools in the district.










Isolation index is a measure of…
\[Isolation = \sum_{i=1}^{n} \left(\frac{B_i}{B} \right) \left(\frac{B{_i}}{T_i} \right)\] Where:

\(B_i\) is the number of students of a particular racial group in a school \(i\).
\(B\) is the total number of students of the same racial group in the entire district.
\(T_i\) is the total student enrollment of the district \(i\).
\(n\) is the number of schools in the district.

















The Dissimilarity index is a measure of…
Dissimilarity index was calculated following Wang et al.’s, methods found here.
\[Dissimilarity = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \left|\frac{b_i}{B}  - \frac{w{_i}}{W} \right|\] Where:

\(b_i\) is the number of students of a particular racial group in school \(i\).
\(B\) is the total number of students of the same racial group enrolled in the district.
\(w_i\) is the number of white students in school \(i\).
\(W\) is the total number of white students enrolled in the district.
\(n\) is the number of schools in the district.

title: School Segregation Descriptive Report
text:
Questions for the group

There seems to be conflicting information regarding what schools are metro vs. not?
Do we want to add all charter and private schools or are we only focused on private schools?
Some school districts have common names (St. Paul Public School District vs. Sain Paul Public Schools | Eden Prairie vs. Eden Paririe Public School District | etc.) - do we merge these or are they separate districts?
The total enrollment seems to be a decimal. Is it appropriate to round down? (conservative)
Many schools are missing level over time, and some have conflicting levels (High School in 2011 and 2013 but Other/Ungraded in 2012). Can we impute standard levels across schools?
Hmong College Prep (and likely others) have some data quality issues (2010 has 100% hispanic students - assuming data entry error) - can we correct these instances?
Which free/reduced lunch/meausre do we use? Manual or the imputed values? Manual is more conservative.
Is exposure index same as interaction index?

section: Number of Schools Closed and Opened Over Time
text:
Number of Schools Closed and Opened Over Time






Limitations



A school closure is defined as any school that had students for at least one year followed by no students in a subsequent year. A school opening is defined as a school that had no students after 1991 but enrolled students before 2022 for at least one year. Some schools reopen after being closed, and only their initial closure is reflected in this analysis.

section: Impact of School Closures on Students Across the Metro
text:
Impact of School Closures on Students Across the Metro






Limitations



Any estimates of counts of people affected by school closures will be imperfect because it’s hard to account for schools that closed and reopened multiple times. With that said, this analysis selects only the first instance a school closed to estimate the number of students impacted.
